availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Nesbitt (Bath County, Kentucky, attorney.)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Mary E. Nesbitt. Father of Thomas G. Nesbitt, John J. Nesbitt, Maria E. Nesbitt, William Nesbitt, General J. Nesbitt, Mary B. Nesbitt, Charles Nesbitt, Sarah Nesbitt, and Edward H. Nesbitt. Attorney in Bath County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Attorney in Bath County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, 2nd Division, p. 1A. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, 2nd Division. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 83. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 75A. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, 2nd Division, p. 63A-B. Find A Grave, "James Monroe Nesbitt (1819 - 1888)," Memorial #45488105, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/45488105 (accessed January 30, 2018).
